definition: compilation/selected works
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen
to choose/to pick/to select/to elect

sentences.english: This volume contains selections from his early works.
sentences.chinese: 該捲包含了他的早期作品文選。

sentences.english: There are special reasons why Qi Liang Fu was not included in Wenxuan.
sentences.chinese: 但《文選》不錄齊梁賦，卻有其特殊原因。

sentences.english: John's composition are always heavy- footed.
sentences.chinese: 約翰的作文選詞總是不當。

sentences.english: There are various problems in Selections, but it was not compiled in haste.
sentences.chinese: 《文選》存在着種種問題，然非倉促成書。

sentences.english: Scanlon, Jennifer, ed. The Gender and Consumer Culture Reader. 2000.
The bad criticism to The Selection of Literary Works by Sushi, affected his spread.
sentences.chinese: 蘇軾對《文選》惡評頗多，影響了《文選》的流佈。

sentences.english: The bad criticism to The Selection of Literary Works by Sushi, affected his spread.
sentences.chinese: 蘇軾對《文選》惡評頗多，影響了《文選》的流佈。

sentences.english: Sorry, I don't have this book. Can you provide the proof?
sentences.chinese: 你有沒有沈文選的《平幾證明全書習題解答》？

sentences.english: Thus, Dissolved Gases in oil is used as character of the fault diagnosis.
sentences.chinese: 因此，本文選用油中溶解氣體作爲故障診斷的特徵量。

sentences.english: Wenxuan selected by Xiao Tong is the earliest existing set of poems.
sentences.chinese: 蕭統《文選》是我國現存最早的一部詩文總集。

sentences.english: I made the book crinkle and black with a mess.
sentences.chinese: 我把那本作文選揉皺了，揩黑了。

sentences.english: LI-xiang was the famous scholar of WenXuan in modern times.
sentences.chinese: 李詳是我國近代著名的《文選》學家。

sentences.english: In the period of Song Dynasties, Literary Selections was spread in the South more flourishingly than in the North.
sentences.chinese: 兩宋時《文選》的流佈區域呈現南方盛於北方的局面。

sentences.english: The first chapter is the survey of "epistolary".
sentences.chinese: 第一章主要是《文選》“書信體”概說。

sentences.english: Wenxuan had exerted a profound influence on later ages literature development.
sentences.chinese: 《文選》對後世文學的發展具有深遠的影響。

definition: to annotate (ancient texts)/commentaries

A Mirror for the Wise Ruler (or Comprehensive Mirror for Aid in Government), a vast chronological general history, written by 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] Sima Guang (1019-1089) and collaborators during the Northern Song in 1084, covering the period 403 BC-959 AD, 294 scrolls

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
variant character/loan word/variant written form (for the same word)/different edition
Shen Yue (441-513), writer and historian during Liang of Southern dynasties 南朝梁, compiler of History of Song of the Southern dynasties 宋書|宋书
sound and meaning
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
Three Hundred Tang Poems, an anthology collected around 1763 by Sun Zhu 孫誅
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
Classic of Rites
Zhang Dai (1597-c. 1684), late Ming scholar
to copy (a text) from person to person/(of a text) to be transmitted by copying
to make a copy of
A New Account of the Tales of the World, collection of anecdotes, conversations, remarks etc of historic personalities, compiled and edited by Liu Yiqing 劉義慶|刘义庆[Liu2 Yi4 qing4]
form of writing novels that comprise lots of poetry in the body of the text, popular in the Ming Dynasty
